p: It was observed that systems put in place during the Ebola outbreak were instrumental in COVID-19 response and management in Nigeria, accounting for some level of institutional readiness and general alertness. Even though the disruptions wrought by COVID-19 were far greater than Ebola, these systems provided the basis for initial support. Therefore, whatever structures are in place now or are being rebuilt should be resilient enough for future emergencies, including climate change adaptation measures.
